bio: Slavoj Žižek (born March 21, 1949) is a Slovenian philosopher, cultural critic, psychoanalyst, and film critic renowned for his provocative commentary on ideology, capitalism, and popular culture. Grounded in Lacanian psychoanalysis and Hegelian philosophy, he has authored numerous influential books and articles that blend rigorous academic theory with accessible cultural analysis.
